intro: Scleranthus × retropuberulus, commonly known as the hybrid meadow sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are pink to reddish in color. Scleranthus × retropuberulus is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
